snippet: Ambivalence about legally administered death has long run much deeper among Europeans than among Americans. In the United States, there is new pressure to scale it back.
lead_paragraph: Ambivalence about legally administered death has long run much deeper among Europeans than among Americans. In the United States, there is new pressure to scale it back.

headline.main: U.S. Edges Closer to Europe in Attitude Toward Capital Punishment, Experts Say
headline.print_headline: Hints of an American Pivot on Capital Punishment
